adjective.description: (of a person or organization) declared in law unable to pay outstanding debts.
examples: his father went bankrupt and the family had to sell their home

adjective.description: Completely lacking in a particular quality or value.

noun.description: A person judged by a court to be insolvent, whose property is taken and disposed of for the benefit of creditors.

verb.description: Reduce (a person or organization) to bankruptcy.
examples: the strike nearly bankrupted the union

origin: Mid 16th century: from Italian banca rotta broken bench, from banca (see bank) and rompere to break. The change in the ending was due to association with Latin rupt- broken.
